description: Example: Action reference with parameter overrides. Demonstrates how to customize action behavior by overriding default parameters.

steps.description: Crawl to the item location silently and slowly. Overrides default speed and silent parameters.
Pick up the item silently and gently to avoid noise. Both parameters override action defaults.
Return to escape location at normal speed. Different parameter overrides than first crawl step.

_notes: 1. Parameter overrides to customize action behavior
2. Different parameters for same action in different contexts
3. Multiple target bindings for different locations
4. Chaining actions with different behavioral flags
- Only parameters defined by the action can be overridden
- Omitted parameters use action's default values
- Parameter values must match action's parameter types
- Same action (crawl_to) used twice with different parameters
- Names must match action definitions exactly
Note: The actual parameter names (speed, silent, gentle) are
examples. Real actions define their own parameter schemas.
